business.headline: Revised or belated ITR? What taxpayers should file before December 31With the December 31 deadline fast approaching, many taxpayers are unsure whether they need to file a revised or a belated income tax return. Recent alerts from the income tax department have made it even more important to understand the right option.

8th Pay Commission: How inflation could shape salary and pension revisionsAs discussions around the 8th Pay Commission gather pace, the debate around pay hikes has already begun. Inflation may be under control on paper, yet higher rents and household expenses are shaping expectations from the next salary and pension revision.

Why EPF claims get rejected and how employees can avoid itAn EPF claim rejection can be frustrating, especially when employees need the money urgently. Understanding why claims get rejected and how to avoid common mistakes can save time and stress.

Centre okays 3 new airlines after IndiGo chaos: Shankh Air, Al Hind Air, FlyExpressShankh Air, Al Hind Air and FlyExpress have received no objection certificates from the civil aviation ministry, as the government looks to reduce heavy dependence on a few airlines following recent disruption at IndiGo.
Sensex ends 116 points lower, Nifty below 26,200; Trent gained 2%The S&P BSE Sensex lost 116.14 points to close at 85,408.70, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 35.05 points to end at 85,408.70.

Facing pension delays? EPFO sets new rules to fix EPS contribution mistakesPension delays have long been a worry for many employees. To address this, the EPFO has introduced new rules to correct mistakes in EPS contributions and ensure pension claims are settled smoothly.

8th Pay Commission: How the fitment factor will shape salary and pension increasesAs talks around the 8th Pay Commission gather pace, government employees and pensioners are closely watching one number that could change their monthly income. The fitment factor is set to be the main driver of salary and pension revisions under the new pay panel.

Still waiting for your income tax refund? Simple ways to check your ITR statusWaiting for an income tax refund can be frustrating, especially after filing your return on time. While delays are common, tracking your ITR status online is easy and can give you clarity on where things stand.

Pakistan sells national carrier PIA for Rs 4,300 crore after IMF diktatPakistan, which is surviving on international loans and dole, sold its flag-carrier Pakistan International Airlines (PIA) on Wednesday for PKR 13,500 crore (Rs 4,300 crore). The Pakistani government had to privatise the airline under IMF loan conditions. The Arif Habib Group emerged as the highest bidder.

Coal India shares continue to rally. What's behind the rise?Coal India's sharp rally reflects a mix of restructuring signals, strong fundamentals and sector-wide PSU momentum. With multiple subsidiaries headed for listings, investors see fresh value creation opportunities driving renewed interest in the stock.

Saleem Ahmad takes charge as RVNL CMD, replacing Sukhmal Chand JainSaleem Ahmad is a civil engineering graduate from Jamia Millia Islamia University and brings more than 35 years of experience across large-scale construction and infrastructure projects.

Do you need to file revised ITR after the Income Tax Department's message?The tax department's risk management alert serves as a cautionary prompt, not a formal notice. Taxpayers need revised ITRs only if there are mismatches. Those with correct claims can wait as refunds resume after verification.

Gold rallies to fresh high: Key reasons behind rally and support levels to watchSpot gold rose 0.8% to a fresh all-time high of $4,524 per ounce. With this jump, gold has gained around 72% so far this year.

ITR on hold? Tax department issues clarification on 'risk management' alertsThe tax department's latest clarification aims to ease taxpayer anxiety, stressing that the alerts are advisory and encourage voluntary correction. Refunds will resume once discrepancies are fixed or claims are verified as genuine.
Coca-Cola India bottler HCCB announces plan to lay off 300 workersHindustan Coca-Cola Beverages (HCCB) currently has around 5,000 employees across India and operates 15 manufacturing units.

Gujarat Kidney IPO closes today: Should you subscribe? Here's what GMP suggestsGujarat Kidney IPO is a book-built issue worth Rs 250.80 crore. The entire issue is a fresh issue of 2.20 crore equity shares, with no offer for sale component. This means all the money raised through the IPO will go to the company.

Why some celebrity brands thrive while others fadeFrom Katrina Kaif's Kay Beauty to Kusha Kapila's Underneat, celebrity brands are no longer side projects. While some scale steadily and earn consumer trust, others struggle to outgrow launch buzz. What explains this divide?

Robin Raina denies Eraaya allegations, says 50% shareholding case is still openIn a statement released on December 23, 2025, Robin Raina said that Eraaya Lifespaces has been spreading incorrect information through repeated media statements

Planning to change jobs? Why you should not withdraw your PFA new job usually means better prospects and a fresh start. Yet, in the rush to move on, one costly mistake is common: withdrawing your PF. What feels like easy money today can hurt your long-term financial security.

Tax refund put on hold under risk management? What the message meansA sudden message from the income tax department has unsettled many taxpayers, who are unsure why their returns are under review. Here is all you need to know.

entertainment.headline: Sunidhi Chauhan leaves Mumbai spellbound, Rohan Joshi shares glowing review Comedian Rohan Joshi praised singer Sunidhi Chauhan after attending her 'I Am Home' concert in Mumbai, describing the performance as unforgettable and highlighting Chauhan's energy and artistry.

The Great Indian Kapil Show: Bhangra, banter, World Cup cheer but no Smriti Mandhana The upcoming episode of The Great Indian Kapil Show will celebrate the Indian women's cricket team's recent World Cup victory. Apart from Smriti Mandhana, the show hosted all other cricketers from the World Cup winning team.

Sarvam Maya review: Nivin Pauly's ghost story is irresistible, full of charmRelease Date:Thu Dec 25, 2025 Sarvam Maya movie review: Director Akhil Sathyan's horror comedy, starring Nivin Pauly, Riya Shibu and Aju Varghese, feels like a warm embrace on a cold winter night. With fantasy elements, the film sheds light on faith, belief, grief and feeling the joy.

Double role or flashback? Akshay Kumar's Welcome to the Jungle looks hint at twist Akshay Kumar's appearance in Welcome to the Jungle grabbed fans' attention. The contrasting appearances have sparked speculation about a double role or flashback sequences in the film.

Dhurandhar a nightmare for VFX and hero-worship films: Ram Gopal Varma Director Ram Gopal Varma has questioned the lack of praise from leading figures in Indian cinema for the film Dhurandhar. Varma suggested on X that the film's unprecedented success and approach have unsettled many within the industry.

Shah Rukh Khan cameo in Rajinikanth's Jailer 2? Read what Mithun Chakraborty said Actor Mithun Chakraborty, who features in Rajinikanth's Jailer 2, recently seemed to confirm Shah Rukh Khan's cameo in the much-anticipated sequel, in a Bengali interview

You have to lead by example, introspect: Vicky Kaushal on life after son's birth Vicky Kaushal opened up about his experiences as a new father, sharing insights on how fatherhood has changed his perspective and daily life since the birth of his first son with Katrina Kaif.

Shobhaa De supports Kartik–Ananya's Saat Samundar Paar remix: I adore the track Shobhaa De has defended the Saat Samundar Paar remix from Kartik Aaryan and Ananya Panday's Tu Meri Main Tera, Main Tera Tu Meri, saying she enjoyed the new version amid online backlash.

Mark review: Another super cop Christ-Mass entertainer from Sudeep after MaxRelease Date:Thu Dec 25, 2025 Mark movie review: The second consecutive collaboration between Kichcha Sudeep and director Vijay Karthikeya after Max is equally entertaining if not more, tackles a more complex case, and also carries forward the same flaws.

It's a wrap for Welcome 3: Akshay Kumar shares Christmas greeting from giant cast Akshay Kumar announced the completion of filming for Welcome to the Jungle. The actor expressed excitement over the film's grand scale and wished fans for the coming year.

Dhurandhar works with Pak viewers as we didn't abuse Muslims: Actor Naveen Kaushik Naveen Kaushik, who played Donga in Dhurandhar, discussed the positive reaction to the film from Pakistani audiences. He said Pakistani people recognise the film targets wrongdoers and not an entire community.

Akshaye Khanna was unsure about Rehman Dakait's look at first. Here's why Costume designer Smriti Chauhan revealed how Akshaye Khanna influenced the design process for his character Rehman Dakait in Aditya Dhar's film 'Dhurandhar'. The film has been receiving roaring success at the box office.

With Avatar: Fire and Ash, the epic saga beats Star Wars sequel trilogy globally James Cameron's Avatar: Fire And Ash has pushed the franchise to the top of the highest-grossing trilogies globally. In India, the film is seeing a modest run due to stiff competition from Dhurandhar.

Tu Meri Main Tera review: Kartik-Ananya's film has emotional depth of Pinterest boardRelease Date:Thu Dec 25, 2025 Tu Meri Main Tera Main Tera Tu Meri is all gloss, no depth. Kartik Aaryan and Ananya Panday headline a film that mistakes privilege for conflict and aesthetics for emotion.

Goodbye June review: Kate Winslet's film is a reminder of reconnecting old bondsRelease Date:Wed Dec 24, 2025 Kate Winslet's directorial, 'Goodbye June' is a reminder of reconnecting old bonds in the digital era of nuclear families. Here's our review.

Chutki to Dhurandhar: Gaurav Gera recalls his long association with Ranveer Singh Gaurav Gera's recent social media post takes fans through his journey from the viral Shopkeeper-Chutki videos of 2015 to his latest collaboration with Ranveer Singh, reflecting on their shared comedic history and their roles in the buzzed-about project Dhurandhar.
Ahaan Panday, Aryan Khan, Aneet Padda and the class of 2025 The year 2025 proved to be an interesting year for Bollywood newcomers. We take a look at some of the most noteworthy budding names.

The Middle actor Pat Finn dies at 60 following complications from cancer Pat Finn, known for roles in The Middle and Murphy Brown, died on Monday from cancer complications. The veteran actor and improv performer was known for his contributions to Hollywood television sitcoms.

Lyricist Anand Bakshi's son slams Saat Samundar Paar remix in Tu Meri Main Tera The remix of the classic song Saat Samundar Paar in Kartik Aaryan and Ananya Panday's upcoming film has sparked a major debate, with the original lyricist's family expressing concerns regarding proper credit for the song.

general news.headline: On campus, Aligarh teacher shot twice in head by bike-borne gunman, diesThe deceased has been identified as Rao Danish, a teacher at the ABK Union High School of AMU. According to police, the incident took place around 9 pm near the library canteen within the Civil Lines police station area of the AMU campus. One of the assailants allegedly said, "Danish, now, you will know me."

China's claims on Arunachal now among its core interests: US reportThe US Pentagon report mentioned that China's claims on Arunachal Pradesh, Taiwan and other territorial and maritime claims in the South China Sea were key to achieving the 'great rejuvenation' by 2049.

Live: Tarique Rahman speaks to Muhammad Yunus, to address mega Dhaka rally nextTarique Rahman in Bangladesh Live: Bangladesh's interim government on Tuesday signalled an effort to steady fraying ties with India, with Finance Adviser Salehuddin Ahmed saying Chief Adviser Muhammad Yunus is working to ease tensions by separating economic interests from political rhetoric, even as Dhaka approved buying 50,000 tonnes of rice from India on cost grounds; the outreach came amid a sharp diplomatic flare-up marked by envoy summons, protests around missions in both countries, and New Delhi's demand for a thorough probe into the killing of Bangladeshi student leader Sharif Osman Hadi, with India rejecting what it called false narratives while Dhaka insisted recent anti-India statements do not reflect national sentiment. Stay tuned to Indiatoday.in for live updates.

Ready to marry but...: Rajnath Singh on how Vajpayee handled Pak woman's offerAs the nation marked Atal Bihari Vajpayee's 101st birth anniversary, Defence Minister Rajnath Singh took a trip down memory lane to recount several instances highlighting the former PM's characteristic humour.

Jesus in India: How Christ's lost years gave rise to a modern mythThe unexplained years of Jesus' life, between his youth and ministry, have inspired enduring theories of eastern travel. From Notovitch to Kersten, modern writers shaped a contested story of "Jesus in India."

Nitin Gadkari recalls close encounter with Hamas leader before his assassinationIran confirmed that Hamas political chief Ismail Haniyeh was killed on July 31, 2024, inside a military facility in Tehran, with his bodyguard also killed. The exact method of the attack remained unclear.

Tarique Rahman, Bangladesh's dark prince, returns. Why it's good news for India Live UpdatesTarique Rahman, the son of former Bangladesh Prime Minister Khaleda Zia and once seen as the 'dark prince' of Bangladesh politics, ended his self-imposed exile and returned to Dhaka after nearly two decades. For India, his return will be of much significance.

Allah told me to drag her: UP man harasses sister-in-law, blames 'divine voices'A UP man was arrested again in Ahmedabad for repeatedly harassing and molesting his sister-in-law despite being out on bail in an earlier case. Police said he claimed he acted on instructions from "divine voices" and that Allah told him to drag the woman.
Jesus turned water into wine: Can science do it?Science takes a closer look at the famous miracle where Jesus transformed water into wine to see how chemistry can explain the change.

India successfully tests nuclear-capable K-4 missile from INS Arighaat: SourcesThe successful K-4 test from INS Arighaat reinforces India's nuclear deterrence, showcasing an extended-range submarine-launched ballistic missile (SLBM) that significantly upgrades the Navy's second-strike capabilities.

Dipu Chandra Das and Osman Hadi: Two Bangladesh deaths expose Western biasThe way the West reacted to the deaths of two Bangladeshis has exposed that it has a narrow view of victims, and limits its protests and outrage to its comfort zones. It is complicit in the conspiracy of silence on the lynching of Dipu Chandra Das, even as it grieved the death of Osman Hadi.

Rahul Gandhi praises Karnataka govt for Foxconn jobs ramp-up, BJP accepts complimentCongress MP Rahul Gandhi hailed the recruitment of around 30,000 workers at Foxconn's women-led iPhone plant in Bengaluru in a record ramp-up. Union Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw gave a cheeky response.

Kolkata may drop the ball on a football event, but it never misses at ChristmasCredit where due. Kolkata may have faltered badly while hosting a football event, but year after year it gets Christmas right — bringing people across caste, creed and faith together, which matters more now than ever.

Video: Navi Mumbai airport begins flight ops, first landing gets water saluteNavi Mumbai International Airport began commercial flight operations today with 15 domestic departures, operating for 12 hours initially as airlines connect the new facility to nine Indian cities on day one.

Dhurandhar works with Pak viewers as we didn't abuse Muslims: Actor Naveen KaushikNaveen Kaushik, who played Donga in Dhurandhar, discussed the positive reaction to the film from Pakistani audiences. He said Pakistani people recognise the film targets wrongdoers and not an entire community.

H-1B lottery scrapped: What this means for Indian students and workersThe US has scrapped the H-1B visa lottery, replacing it with a wage-weighted system from 2026. For Indians, who dominate H-1B approvals, the shift changes the rules entirely. Here's what it means for students, early-career professionals, and those still betting on the American dream.

Tu Meri Main Tera review: Kartik-Ananya's film has emotional depth of Pinterest boardRelease Date:Thu Dec 25, 2025Tu Meri Main Tera Main Tera Tu Meri is all gloss, no depth. Kartik Aaryan and Ananya Panday headline a film that mistakes privilege for conflict and aesthetics for emotion.

Christmas brings AQI relief to Delhi as blue skies reappear after weeksDelhi recorded a brief improvement in air quality on Christmas, with clear skies and stronger winds aiding dispersal, but officials have warned that pollution may rise again over the next few days.

When World War I paused for Christmas, and enemy soldiers played footballIn December 1914, British and German soldiers fighting World War I unofficially stopped combat to celebrate Christmas. Known as the Christmas Truce, the moment saw enemies sing carols, exchange gifts, bury the dead, and even play football—creating one of history's most powerful reminders of shared humanity during war.

5 charred to death as bus catches fire after collision with lorry in KarnatakaAt least five people were charred to death after a private sleeper bus caught fire following a head-on collision with a container lorry in Karnataka's Chitradurga district.

The advent calendar craze is finally in India, but is it living up to the hype?Were you surprised to see so many local brands launch their own advent calendars this festive season? Their craze is very real.

The Ro-Ko pull: BCCI deserve plaudits for bringing star power to domestic cricketThe first day of the Vijay Hazare Trophy saw the return of Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli to the domestic circuit, and with it, the attention of the fans came back to the domestic circuit. The BCCI deserves plaudits for making it a mandate for stars to grace the domestic circuit with their presence; they have ensured that they have set up a foundation for bigger things.

Rare snowfall in Saudi deserts: Why it's a big warning for IndiaThe snowfall in the desert signalled to the world that something fundamental is shifting in the planet's climate system, and the consequences are visible.

Vada pav khaoge? Rohit Sharma's reaction to fan's hilarious question goes viralVijay Hazare Trophy: Rohit Sharma's return to domestic 50-over cricket drew thousands of fans to the Sawai Mansingh Stadium in Jaipur. The star batter lit up the contest with a blistering 155 off just 94 balls, earning the Player of the Match award. Beyond his on-field heroics, Rohit also delighted the crowd with his antics, including a playful exchange with a fan.

sports.headline: Manchester United need a saviour? Ex-bidder offers co-owner fresh funds to fix club Former Manchester United bidder Thomas Zilliacus has resurfaced with a renewed £375 million proposal for the English club, a move that could inject immediate financial momentum as the Premier League giants approach the January transfer window.

No room for Shubman Gill even in ex-opener's T20 World Cup alternative squad Former India opener Aakash Chopra did not include Shubman Gill in his alternative T20 World Cup squad, which featured the likes of Yashasvi Jaiswal, KL Rahul, Rishabh Pant and Ruturaj Gaikwad. Gill, who was vice-captain until last month, was also left out of India's 15-man squad for the showpiece event, which begins on February 7.

Watch: Rohit Sharma hugs young Virat Kohli fan during Vijay Hazare clash in Jaipur Rohit Sharma's Vijay Hazare return delivered runs and a touching moment in Jaipur. A spontaneous hug with a young Virat Kohli fan captured the emotion and enduring magic of India's domestic circuit.

Not ideal: Ashwin's bizarre take on Bihar's world record List A total vs Arunachal Indian spin great Ravichandran Ashwin offered a bizarre view on Vaibhav Suryavanshi-inspired Bihar's record-breaking outing against Arunachal Pradesh in the Vijay Hazare Trophy 2025–26.

Ricky Ponting praises Starc's Ashes impact: Don't think I've seen him bowl better Ricky Ponting has lauded Mitchell Starc for his outstanding performances in the ongoing Ashes, pointing to the clear evolution in his bowling. Starc's impact has been central to Australia establishing a commanding 3-0 lead over England.

Virat Kohli fans climb trees in Bengaluru to watch century: See photos During the Vijay Hazare Trophy, while Rohit Sharma enjoyed batting in front of a packed house in Jaipur, Virat Kohli struck a century for Delhi against Andhra in a match played behind closed doors in Bengaluru. Despite the restrictions, a few fans turned up at the BCCI Centre of Excellence and climbed trees to catch a glimpse of their favourite superstar.

Ex-England captain defends Ben Duckett, says few beers on day-off are okay Michael Vaughan has defended Ben Duckett amid scrutiny over England's Noosa break. The former captain insists off-field noise distracts from deeper problems behind England's Ashes collapse in Australia.

Watch: Zinedine Zidane watches son Luca make Algeria debut at AFCON Zinedine Zidane watched proudly as his son Luca made his Algeria debut at AFCON. A composed display in goal capped a dominant win and added a memorable family moment to Algeria's campaign.

Vada pav khaoge? Rohit Sharma's reaction to fan's hilarious question goes viral Vijay Hazare Trophy: Rohit Sharma's return to domestic 50-over cricket drew thousands of fans to the Sawai Mansingh Stadium in Jaipur. The star batter lit up the contest with a blistering 155 off just 94 balls, earning the Player of the Match award. Beyond his on-field heroics, Rohit also delighted the crowd with his antics, including a playful exchange with a fan.

What are the two ISL formats that AIFF have proposed and are they any good? With the ISL season hanging in uncertainty, AIFF have placed two formats before clubs to keep the league alive. Both prioritise survival and cost control, raising bigger questions about Indian football's direction.

Sports news today live: Gill snubbed again, Ashwin offers bizarre take on Bihar Today's Sports News Live Updates: Aakash Chopra has not picked Shubman Gill even in his alternative squad for T20 World Cup. R Ashwin has offered a bizarre take on Bihar smashing the word record in Vijay Hazare Trophy against Arunachal Pradesh. From Steve Smith's return as Australia's Ashes captain at the Boxing Day Test to Real Madrid pushing for full financial disclosure in Barcelona's Negreira case, catch all the biggest sports stories of the day here.

Real Madrid ask for full financial access in FC Barcelona's Negreira row investigationReal Madrid have stepped up their legal pursuit in the Negreira case, demanding full financial transparency from Barcelona. The request underlines how far the rivalry has moved from the pitch into courtrooms.

The Ro-Ko pull: BCCI deserve plaudits for bringing star power to domestic cricketThe first day of the Vijay Hazare Trophy saw the return of Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli to the domestic circuit, and with it, the attention of the fans came back to the domestic circuit. The BCCI deserves plaudits for making it a mandate for stars to grace the domestic circuit with their presence; they have ensured that they have set up a foundation for bigger things.

Steve Smith cleared to captain in Boxing Day Test as Australia name all-pace attackSteve Smith is back in charge as Australia fine-tune plans for the Boxing Day Test at the MCG. With the Ashes secured, selectors will read conditions before locking an all-pace XI.

Players are human, but did England's drinking escapade in Noosa go too far?The Noosa clips grabbed attention, but England's Ashes defeat was decided long before that — by flawed planning, poor preparation, and unanswered questions around priorities and accountability.

FC Goa stage silent protest in ACL2 clash to give ISL's uncertainty more spotlightFC Goa players paused play in their AFC Champions League Two match to highlight uncertainty around the ISL, as Indian football continues to grapple with administrative and commercial turmoil.

Couldn't track the ball: Smith reveals vertigo battle before 3rd Ashes TestSteve Smith described the vertigo issue he was dealing with ahead of the Adelaide Test, which forced him to miss the match. Smith missed his second match in the last six Tests and has opened up about having vertigo symptoms in the past.

No Dream11 sponsorship, no problem: BCCI's general funds increase to Rs 11,346 croreThe BCCI has shrugged off Dream11's exit, bridging the gap with new sponsorship deals as its finances remain strong and surpluses grow despite a dip in ICC revenue.

Vijay Hazare Wrap: What happened apart from Rohit and Kohli in Round 1Vijay Hazare Trophy's 2025-26 season began on Wednesday, December 24. Here is a comprehensive wrap of what happened in the Round 1 fixtures. However, this article focusses on the performances beyond Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma, who were on fire today.

Yash Dayal's bail plea rejected by Jaipur POCSO court in alleged rape caseA Jaipur special POCSO court rejected cricketer Yash Dayal's anticipatory bail plea, citing serious allegations involving a minor and ruling that the stage of investigation did not justify pre-arrest protection.

Last prodigy was Sachin. Shashi Tharoor backs Vaibhav Suryavanshi for India call-upVaibhav Suryavanshi's stunning 190 in the Vijay Hazare Trophy has reignited calls for an India senior call-up, with Shashi Tharoor and Aakash Chopra backing the 14-year-old after Bihar's world-record total.

Too easy? Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli show Vijay Hazare isn't their testToo easy? Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli did not need domestic cricket to prove themselves, but their return to the Vijay Hazare Trophy created the buzz the tournament was hoping for. Rohit struck a daddy hundred to lead Mumbai's chase against Sikkim in Jaipur, while Kohli lived up to his 'chase master' tag with a fluent 131 off 101 balls for Delhi against Andhra in Bengaluru.

National Sports Awards: No cricketer in shortlist, Hardik Singh sole Khel Ratna nomineeThere were no cricketers in the shortlist for the National Sports Awards with Hardik Singh being the sole nominee for the Khel Ratna honour this year. Teenage chess star Divya Deshmukh and Tejaswin Shankar were among the athletes picked for the Arjuna awards.

Ex-AUS coach backs England amid drinking controversy: Running a campaign against themFormer Australia coach Darren Lehmann defended the England team amidst reports of heavy drinking during their mid-Ashes break in Noosa. Reports of misconduct from England players emerged after their loss in Adelaide to Australia.

Devdutt Padikkal 147 powers Karnataka to second-highest List A run chaseVijay Hazare Trophy: Devdutt Padikkal's superb 147-run knock helped Karnataka chase down the 413-run target against Jharkhand to complete the second-highest run chase in the history of List A cricket.

Gambhir dekh raha hai na? Fans troll coach after Rohit's hundred in JaipurVijay Hazare Trophy: India coach Gautam Gambhir got taunted by fans at the Sawai Mansingh Stadium. The fans went berserk in Jaipur after Rohit Sharma scored his fastest ever List A hundred on his comeback to the Vijay Hazare Trophy.

Stokes calls Ashes tour his toughest test as England captain, vows to face it head onUnder intense scrutiny after going 0–3 down in the Ashes, England captain Ben Stokes has called it the toughest phase of his leadership but insists he will not run away from responsibility, backing his players to finish strong.

A mother's sacrifice, a son's record: Sakibul hits fastest Vijay Hazare hundredOnce his mother was forced to pawn her jewelry so he could own a bat, Bihar captain Sakibul Gani has now scored the fastest hundred in the history of the Vijay Hazare Trophy.

Bavuma on Bumrah-Pant apology over bauna remark, Conrad grovel commentTemba Bavuma said that Indian stars Jasprit Bumrah and Rishabh Pant apologised to him for the Bauna remark and reacted to the grovel comment made by South Africa coach Shukri Conrad during the Test series against India.

Jasprit Bumrah's no 1 Test rank in danger, Tilak Varma enters top 3 in T20IsIndia fast bowler Jasprit Bumrah's reign at the top of the ICC bowling rankings is under threat as Pat Cummins jumped four places to be on the second spot. Tilak Varma has entered top 3 in T20Is, following his heroics against South Africa.

City group pulls out of Mumbai City FC due to Indian football uncertainty: ReportIn a big blow to Indian football, the City Football Group have decided to pull out of Mumbai City FC, according to a latest report. CFG have been asssociated with Mumbai since 2019 and helped change the fortunes of the club.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
